pageContext.claim: “If Ronald Reagan, who I consider being top notch, if he came here, he'd have a couple of hundred of people, legitimately, he'd have af -- he'd go into a ballroom, someplace inside, he'd go into a ballroom and it'd have a -- 2-300 people. And that's for -- you know, that's what the standard were. We're having 25, 30, 35, 40, 45,000 people.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump has not been getting crowds of 25,000 to 45,000 during this stretch of rallies. And Reagan attracted huge crowds. For instance, in 1984, a Reagan rally [attracted 100,000 people to a rally in Doylestown, about two hours away from Hersey, Penna., where Trump spoke in 2019 to a crowd estimated to be about 10,000 people.
